description:
This is one of the bakeries that you should not forget especially their pain de levain. Hog Island Oyster Co. order their bread from this location which is a plus because their seafood dishes are so amazing. Acme rustic sweet bread goes well with oysters, seafood and their rustic tomato stew. It's like you are in heaven.
But anyway back to Acme Bread Company - this bakery has excellent and great bread. I go for the rustic sweet bread, pain de levain, sometimes the sourdough, and their baked treats adds another level of deliciousness.
I get a loaf of the rustic sweet bread every 2 weeks or if I come by to SF Ferry building for food shopping.
This is also the closest location to get my fix of Acme Bread. The bakers and cashiers guide which bread to buy. They are baked fresh daily.
author: Jade M.

description:
My favorite bakery in San Francisco.

Everything I have tried here has been great, from the croissants and rolls to their breads.

The wife an I will buy some goodies and then walk over to Peet's or Blue Bottle for a coffee and sit in the public area and watch the people come and go.

I always get an onion slab to take home -- it's a very savory bread with loads of green onions inside.  Last time I decided to try their walnut-cranberry bread.  It did not disappoint -- a very hearty brown bread loaded with goodies.

If you are at the Ferry Building, don't miss this.
author: Jaime C.

description:
This is the ferry building edition of acme bakery and while the name may be generic nothing else about this place is.

Parking? Nope. The closest garage is the embarcadero center and baby, it ain't cheap. If you feel lucky you could try for nearby street parking, and there is a smaller not well defined lot in back by the Gandhi statue-but I've haven't figured out yet if that is official non ticketed/towed parking or just people being innovative. The good news is that this is a transportation hub-ferries, the streetcar, bicycle hub and this part of the city is extremely walk able.

This is a small walk up spot-like a lot of things in the ferry building-and as such does not have dedicated seating. Most folks grab and go, and if they feel like sitting they go out to the ocean facing benches behind the building.

The focus here is on the bread. They make dozens of rolls and loaves some of which are arguably the best in the city. There are no weaknesses in the lineup-the quality is extraordinarily high, but my regular go-to's are the Italian style country loaf and the sourdough. Hard to go wrong with those. They also have range of pastries (usually but not exclusively french styled) racked up in front in an amazing display case. They also have a limited selection of ready to go sandwich thingys which are what the lines are for mostly. I note that they can run out of some things towards the afternoon. Unless you get there in the first wave of folks, there can be lines which don't move as quick as you'd like, but overall it's well worth your time and money. Pricing may seem high-but not once you consider the location or the sheer goodness of the product. Loaves and sandwiches are priced at six bucks or so and while the pastries are by piece-2-3 dollars starting-it's hard to just buy one. 

So, come for the sandwiches, but stay for the breads.
author: Steven W.

description:
Phenomenal bread!

Everything is fresh, delicious, and affordable ( well by SF standards).

Great to pickup a battard, some cheeses next door, and some sliced meats and have a great picnic.
author: David G.

description: Who doesn't love some good sour dough bread when they're in San Francisco?! Loved the little mini loaves. Crisp on the outside but soft and chewy on the inside! All kinds of other breads to choose from, too. Located in The Marketplace building right next to the ferry terminal. Nice staff.
author: Mary Lou S.

description:
How do you make all organic bread??? You don't! You go to acme. They make the impossible. You just wait in line and eat!! 

The sandwiches sell out faster than you can spell sandwiches! But they have plethora of bread! Loafs, rolls, baguettes, sour dough, sweet rolls! So much bread! Smell and taste amazing! 

And it's so cheap!!! For organic and labor intensive!!  Got a whole baguette, sweet! For $3! It's insane how cheap! And it's oh so good. I ate it as I walk the ferry building! While waiting for my table at hog island oyster. All they needed was some olive oil out. I might just not leave this place!
author: Latifa S.

description: I do not believe this is the main Bakery but we purchase Acme bread at several grocery stores in Central and Northern California. This is a nice find with a very fresh selection and good prices.
author: Greg D.

description:
I love the bread here! Over the weekend, you can expect the line to be quite long. On the weekdays, there isn't much of a wait and they take Square which is super convenient.   

If you're at the ferry building, grab a loaf of the freshly baked walnut and some olive oil/balsamic vinegar down the hall and you're good to go for dinner!
author: Annie Z.

description: Delicious baked goods in the Ferry building. Was there on a weekend so the line was long, but stay at it, the line moves quick. Got the almond croissant, so flaky and buttery, and the cheese swirl, which was good in taste but a bit too chewy, would have been better if it was toasted which wasn't an option I think.
author: Sudipto G.

description:
I wasn't blown away by Acme bread, maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. We tried their croissant and it wasn't buttery at all - in fact it tasted cheap. We got the chocolate as well as a plain one, it was quite honestly as bad as cheap grocery store croissants. 

I think if I did give Acme another chance I would try their loaf breads, but I was craving croissants and thought it would be a safe bet as it seems they are quite established as bread makers. They have plenty of inventive looking loaves.. but their croissants are awful.
author: Mary P.

description: FIVE STARS! Actually TEN STARS. Man, I love this place. Anything your bread loving heart might desire. I love that they have sandwiches ready made to go - so easy. Get the Salami - you won't be disappointed!! I come here every time we are at the Ferry Building. We usually get a sandwich to eat here and some bread to bring home. Everything is wonderful - can't go wrong. Definitely come here!!
author: Wanda G.

description:
Really great bread - a bit touristy being in the ferry building with very long lines at times but overall decent prices for the quality. Sandwiches can be a hit or a miss - I had gotten one with cheese and fruit jam - it was towards the end of the day so the cheese was a little dried and the jam wasn't my thing. They have a selection of ~3 sandwiches a day until they run out.

My favorite is the epi baguette- soft inside with a crunchy crust - so good! It's also the bread that hog island oyster serves in its restaurant.
author: Brenda L.

description:
When I travel, I realize that Bay Area bread is among the best in the world.  

Acme uses organic ingredients and their olive bread and walnut breads are the best I've ever tasted.

Their sourdough is also great but the olive bread is my favorite. My children snack on it whenever it's in the house. I like it with just a little butter but it's so good plain, too.

It's really difficult for me to eat plain grocery store white bread now.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Simple breads but made with perfection!!! My friend and I had the beets sandwich and the cheese sandwich. Both were simple but unique. The beets was refreshing! Beets don't really have a distinct flavor but it's sweet! It was so good! The cheese one was good. If you like Brie then you will like it. Not too salty! 

For under 7 dollars, I was very satisfied because I didn't over stuff myself. Some people may need a bit more than the sandwich for lunch but it was good for me :) def try it out if you are in the area! I can't wait to try other breads!
author: Joyce S.

description:
I tried Acme Bread Company for lunch a couple of days ago. It is located in the Ferry building so at the peak lunch hour like every other place it had a huge line. Acme Bread Company specializes in different kinds of bread so it is not a natural choice for lunch, but due to a late breakfast, I just wanted to do a light sandwich so Acme fitted the bill perfectly. I decided to get the Green Garlic Sandwich ($6.48). I managed to get the last sandwich so it is advisable to come early if you want to get your hands on one.

I would describe the sandwich as minimalistic yet terrific. It is garlic, roasted red peppers, balsamic vinaigrette and black pepper all housed in a baguette. The sandwich has a nice crunch but it is not overly crunchy. It has a nice chew but is not overly chewy. Yes it is pricy but fine for the location. Yes it is a small portion which will do only for a light meal, but it is totally worth it.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
The best apple turnover I have ever had in my life. Feel a little bit stuffed if eat the whole thing but it is just way too delicious. 

All rye breads are recommended.
author: Sunny B.

description: Long line but it moved pretty quick. Fiancée for a cheese sandwich and I a sourdough cheese wheel. Cheese wheel was tasty fiancée loved her cheese sandwich.
author: Juan M.

description:
The best bread in the Bay, hands down. Cheap, fresh, and truly delicious, it does not get better than this. Perfect crumb, perfect crust, every time. This is our go-to bread. We buy from Milk Pail Market in Mountain View mostly (two deliveries daily!), but when we're in SF, we always cruise by the Ferry Building outpost to snare some uberfresh loaves. Our favorites are sweet/sour baguette, sweet/sour batard, herb slab, and pain au levain.

If you're in SF and want good bread, go to Acme. Period.
author: Lis B.

description:
There's a big line for this shop. If you are there well before lunch, the line is short.

Just for fun, I bought a sour batard, chocolate croissant, and cinnamon/currant bread roll. I would pass on the cinnamon/currant bread roll next time.
author: Monica S.

description: Got the sweet baguette and it came out warm, soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. Doesn't get much better than that, especially for $2.62 for a fresh out of the oven baguette.
author: Lily L.

description: Long lines here since it's a tourist destination, but moves quick. Bread is also a really fair price, we bought a baguette and a few small items and made it out under $10. Really good bread!
author: Vladi Z.

description:
I'm a huge bread aficionado so naturally I HAD to try out some rolls from Acme Bread. From the get-go, I was very surprised at how affordable priced all the bread is. A roll is ~$1 and a full baguette is ~$2.50. Coming from New York, I've bought nice baguettes for waaay more... rip. 
I got a something crossed bun and an olive roll. The something crossed bun is basically a hot crossed bun without the cross. It's a light sweet bread chock full of currants and orange (or is it apricot?).  The olive bun had a more typical bread roll texture with pieces of green olive. The olives are salty but not too salty, and in a great ratio to the bread.  I had bites of both with a cup of coffee. Sweet and savory, sometimes the best things in life are the simplest!!
Overall, I would 100% come again.  The rolls I had were amazing and affordable and I would love to try their other offerings.
author: Amy X.

description: Well, it was end of the day but I thought this place has great traffic everything must be fresh.  To my horror both green onions slab and a loaf of sourdough were STALE as if made yesterday.  Ouch
author: Konki T.

description:
What can I really say other than they make some damn good bread?

Got a sourdough loaf and an Italian loaf, both were fresh, baked to perfection.

The sourdough was the star, perfectly crisp outside and soft chewy inside. Toasted with some butter is the way to have it, with a nice charred crust and crispy inside.
author: Rob W.

description:
Carbs carbs carbs! I'm bi-polar when it comes to carbs! I have a love/hate relationship with Carbs! Carbs makes me fat, but I love it in my mouth!

So many delicious choices to choose from!! I ended up with a sourdough cheese wheel! It was very chewy, but so delicious! I love that hard cheddar cheese on a nice toasted bread! Yum!!
author: Darlene M.

description: Great bread is the first thing to get six sigma-Ed and few places in america value good bread. Sf is rare because it's a foodie City. See, good bread is expensive to make and it spoils easily! Other places pretend to make fresh baked bread but it's really not good quality dough like acme and they freeze it and rebake it which isn't the same thing as making it for real. You need educated smart people who care enough to support it and we're lucky we have that here. So the sandwiches are superb and it made things open my eyes and I can't enjoy sandwiches at most other places now... unless you go to Europe. It's a real bakery too, not a pastry paradise calling itself a bakery. Yum!
author: Romy I.

description:
The bread here is spectacular!! Prices are a little steep, but hey, this is SF and the bread is amazing. 

We got the green garlic sandwich and the cheese sandwich. 

Omg the cheese sandwich blew my brains away! If you're here for a grilled sandwich, this isn't it, but do give this sandwich a shot. I think the cheese was Brie, and it was combined with jam, arugula, and black pepper - everything just pairedso well together and the bread was the perfect baguette! 

Onto the green garlic sandwich - my friend thought this was sensational. Don't get me wrong, I really enjoyed it as well, but I couldn't get over the cheese bread. It was stuffed with enough cheese (and might I add flavorful, especially with the balsamic) and some roasted red bells. The soft texture of the insides were a great contrast to the rustic baguette.
author: Jacqueline T.

description: This is one of my favorite bakeries in San Francisco - the land of the sourdough bread.  My favorite item to get here is the sourdough cheese wheel.  It is so delicious and if you go early in the morning (7am-9am), it's so fresh.  I usually come here to start my eating adventure in San Francisco whenever I visit.  Their other items are delicious as well - apple turnover, olive roll, baguette, etc.  I really appreciate the signs - each sign tells you the ingredients which is helpful if you have allergies or food preferences.  The prices are pretty good considering it's in the ferry terminal and very touristy.  Definitely check this place out before you board the ferry!
author: Julie Ying X.

description: We love their best bread!! My family and I are visiting SF right now and so far we had their French Baguette, the Cheese Sandwich(the cowgirl creamery cream cheese, fig jam, arugula & black pepper), the Potato Pesto sandwich(boiled sliced potato, some kind of cheese, and pesto) and the walnut cranberry bread(this is waiting to be eaten for breakfast tomorrow) and we love all of them that we've tried so far! The price for the sandwiches are just perfect too! Highly recommend!!
author: Anna K.

description: You know this is a good bakery of my wife likes it. She doesn't even like the Filipino Pandesal. But she liked this one. Please open one up in LB! Loved their sourdough bread. Best ever! Will be back.
author: Edward S.

description:
Excellent quality bread! From baguettes to rolls to batards, Acme Bread has a huge variety of artisan breads that are addictive to any carb lover. All of the breads are made organic flour and baked right at this location inside the Ferry Building. One of the best things about this Acme Bread location is that you can eat right on the waterfront with a beautiful view of the bay. They also offer sandwiches with fresh, local ingredients served on their rustic sweet baguette. The fillings in the sandwiches are not excessive, but instead minimal (or just enough), which allows you to taste more of their fresh bread.

Recently, I tried the Cheese Sandwich, which has Cowgirl Creamery's triple crème cheese, fruit jam, arugula, and black pepper. The sandwich was delicious...especially if you are a quality cheese and bread type of person. The sweet fruit jam and arugula gives the sandwich nice additional flavors. Such simple ingredients, yet so tasty. 

I also tried the Roasted Beet Sandwich, which has marinated roasted beets, chevre with horseradish, and watercress. If you love beets, you will love this sandwich. It's very tasty and the horseradish give it a little kick (not overpowering at all). Almost any sandwich made on Acme Bread is guaranteed to be good. In addition to the sandwiches, I've really enjoyed their Pain Epi and Green Onion Slab.

Their prices are reasonable too. Currently, all sandwiches are $6.17 (I know it's gone up over the years).  

Acme Bread Company is famous in the Bay Area for their organic, fresh, and tasty breads and this location provides access to them all. If you are going to eat fresh bread, your best bet is to get it from Acme.
author: Jean S.

description: Amazing bread!! Great wait to deal with the wait of Hog Island Oyster. Short wait and easy to choose the bread by looking at all options in front of you.
author: Guillermo M.

description:
Love their Pain epi bread. Their other breads are also good, but this is  my favorite.
Each time I go to the Ferry Building, I must go to Acme Bread.
Many restaurants in San Francisco serve their bread.
author: Gayle G.

description: Lots of choices and the line moves really quickly at this bakery, so don't let that deter you! That being said, it might be best to figure out what you're getting quickly too. I got the small sourdough round and it was amazing - I'll definitely be back to get that again (plus more). I definitely recommend this place for its quality bread and fair prices.
author: Alaina P.

description:
I buy bread here EVERY week. There can be a lot of tourists but the line moves fast and it's not as bad at off-peak times. 

Fave breads:
* olive bread (also the smaller version, olive roll, as a snack)
* pumpkin bread (seasonal; also comes as a roll)
* pain epi
* sourdough baguette
* small sour round 
* walnut levain 

Bread is king here but they also make a small selection of pastries that are tasty as well. I like the sourdough cheese roll and chocolate croissant. 

They take card but you get a discount if you use cash.
author: Yi Y.

description: We got the olive roll and it was delicious! The bread was fresh and the olives were a surprisingly good addition to bread.
author: Courtney L.

description: Acme bread is classic. Great selection of well over a baker's dozen varieties of bread. The walnut raisin is a star and so is the olive bread. The pastries aren't to my taste, they are just slightly better than a Costco croissant.
author: Alex R.

description:
Great bread. Holy moly. You can get it at bi-rite as well so if you don't want to wait in line at the ferry building you can get it somewhere else (almost as) fresh! 
I simply eat this bread plain that's how good. Great with oil and soups. Have it for a sandwich or with hummus. Organic, simple, and leave you feeling not run down but energized.
author: Carly A.

description: Everything looked so yummy, but I could only get one pastry and I opted for an almond croissant. It was a good sized croissant and it was delicious! Flaky, buttery, and just sweet enough. The cinnamon roll looked really tempting. It was huge; almost the size of my head and I have a pretty big head. Prices of the pastries I saw ranged from $2.89-3.50, which is not bad considering the size.
author: Manami Y.

description:
I spent a few hours at the Farmers Market visiting and eating my way through the crowds.  I stopped into Cow Girl Creamery which required a stop in to Acme.  

Don't worry, the line moves quickly.  The bread is always amazing!  The best part was that two rolls and a loaf was just under $4.  What?!

What did I learn today?  I should have purchased twice as much.  My bread to cheese ratio was off.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This bread is GOOD! I was surprised there wasn't a crazy line for their bread.  

Reading Yelp reviews told me that this was a can't-miss place.  How dare I think my Yelp friends would be wrong? We came at lunch time and initially thought to grab some cheese from Cowgirl and then bring that to Acme to make my own sandwich.  However, I didn't need to do that as there were some pre-made sandwiches at Acme that already HAD COWGIRL CREAMERY CHEESE in it! So I got the cheese sandwich with a sweet jam on that heavenly bread.  My fiance got the salame sandwich.  These are made in a limited batch each day and once gone, they gone.  The guy behind me got the last salame sandwich, phew!

I picked up two small loaves to bring back to the OC.  I can't wait to try them today with some hot butter!
author: Milee S.

description:
Shame on you if you don't do yourself a favor and buy a hunk of bread here and a slab of cheese next door at the Cowgirl Creamery.

That is all.
author: Allie A.

description: Best bakery by far in San fran. Amazing sourdough and awesome staff! Love it here every time we're in town!
author: Joe R.

description: The cheese sandwich was absolutely perfect. Perfect ingredients, perfect quality, perfect size. The bead is acme so it's incredible, the cheese is cowgirl so it's incredible, the jam and arugula were delicious. I could eat this every day.
author: L B.

description:
Oh my god this bread was amazing! I thought it would be average and overpriced considering the location but i was so wrong. We ordered a bunch of small breads just to try them all. 
I could really feel the texture of everything I was trying. 
I really can't say how jealous I am that we don't have similar bread where I live. It is probably not the cheapest but I don't find it that expensive either.

If you love bread you have to go there!
author: Stanimir C.

description: Good to grab sth b4 it closed for next morning breakfast :) also sell bamboo fabric made container bag for bread storage. I like its smooth texture n green logo
author: Freya-Loki O.

description: I LOVE Acme Bread! It's honestly the best. Had the opportunity to get a tour of this location with a kids cooking camp and it was awesome! The staff was super friendly and we got to learn about the entire bread making process
author: Rylee P.

description:
Darling A,

I know it has been a while since we were last together.  As much as it pains me, I felt that I had no choice.  It's always the same w you carb types.  No matter how hard I try, you always succeed in rendering me helpless against your very strong seductive powers.  I get weak.

It doesn't matter what fragrance you wear...sourdough, rustic, wheat, sweet, or cinnamon.  It doesn't matter how you're dressed...w butter, jam, cream cheese, or Brie.  Just one whiff of you fills me w yearnings that are hard to control.  I have to be strong.  I must focus & maintain composure enough to at least feign that I don't actually miss you like crazy.  I pretend that I don't still think about you.  

But I do.

It's your chocolate cherry sourdough that haunts me the most.  That was our first date, remember?  You opened up a whole new world to me, & even after all of this time, I still haven't forgotten.

Maybe you've heard that I've been seeing a lot of Gluten Free Bread lately.  It's true.  GF Bread & I have become very close.  We've done breakfasts, lunches, & dinners.  GF was even included at Christmas dinner this year.  And, GF actually passed the friend test.  It hasn't been easy for either of us, though.  Just the other day, I broke down & gave in to hush puppies & peach cobbler.  But GF totally understood. 

But, I learned something.  I learned that no matter how happy I think I am w GF, I still can't quit you, Acme.  I'm just not ready to give you up completely.

Yes, I still love you Acme.  There, I said it.  Are you happy now?  You knew this all along, didn't you?  You knew that our bond is much too strong for GF to ever completely penetrate.  

I've learned it the hard way.  You just can't be replaced.

Yours truly,

V.

P.S.  See you soon.  Will you put on your best herb slab for me?  Xoxo
author: Veronica M.

description:
Croissants, sourdough, rolls, loaves, batards... the list goes on!  Everything I've had here has been amazing!

The olive loaf has real olives in it, and they don't taste like they've been sitting out forever, or dried up.  They're serious pieces of olives, and the loaf pairs well with a light cheese from the Cowgirl Creamery next door.

I also love to get the croissants for breakfast in the mornings.  They're not the BEST croissant I've ever had, but they are definitely worth the calories.

But hands down, the best thing here is the sourdough cheese wheel.  It's amazing!  In fact, they often run out at the end of the day.. so be sure to grab one (or a few) if you can.  If you miss out, they have a sourdough cheese ball which has all the same ingredients (but isn't as good in my opinion).
author: Kenna H.

description:
This was the absolutely amazing fresh bread vendor in the Ferry Building! 

On our way to the Wine Train I figured I should put something in my tummy before the copious amounts of wine. Enter in Acme!

You could smell the loaves from the vendor next door and I took a moment just to decide what I wanted, because I wanted everything! I ended up picking up a very reasonable fist sized bread balls, one was deliciously crusty and the other very savory with just a hint of rosemary!

The service was police and quick and I would definitely be back! I just wish they sold bacon! ;D
author: Meg T.

description:
3.5 stars

I know this place is good. My first time was 5 years ago when I tried their herb slab and it was awesome. It tasted so fresh and was perfect with a nice hot cup of coffee for breakfast. This time, I was at the Ferry Building for lunch and decided that I wanted something more than just bread so I decided to get one of their sandwiches. They only have 3 types (all $6.19 each), but by the time I got there, they only had 1 type left, which was the beet sandwich. I have to say as much as I like beets, I didn't really enjoy this sandwich. Its paired with chevre cheese, which I now realize I'm not a big fan of because the flavor is quite strong. The bread was a bit harder than I expected too. What I really wanted to try was their cheese sandwich so make sure to get there early. The sandwiches are probably fresher earlier too. It wasn't even 1pm when I got there.

Next time I'm at the Ferry Building, I'll probably just stick with the bread and grab some cheese next door at Cowgirl Creamery. The sandwiches are a convenient option because they've essentially done that for you, but sometimes being able to choose the type of bread and cheese you want is better.
author: Alice L.

description:
I came here on a Saturday evening to try some of their bread and popular sandwiches. I realized that they did not serve sandwiches past 2:30 pm. I had read some reviews and was aware that paying in cash = discount. These were not at all expensive. Since the sandwiches were not available, I tried to quickly list the breads I wanted. The service was not that great. There was only 1 group behind me but I still felt hurried. I think they are so used to customers who know exactly what they want that they have no time to entertain customers like me who are eager to try different kinds. I finally ordered some rolls and a cross bun. The breads were tasty with a good crusty exterior. Having the bread made me wonder....how old and artificial is the bread in most restaurants all around us where we get our burgers and sandwiches?! This is how bread is supposed to taste all the time...
This took me back to the time I used to have "pav" freshly baked from bakeries in India. While the breads here were delightful, I feel equally disappointed that a good piece of bread has to be so rare and sought after these days.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Always great to stop here. Love the bread. Love how helpful everyone is. Really love that olive bread and the herb slab! And what great prices.  Just ate one of my chocolate croissants.  Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Alex M.

description: Acme never fails to make great bread! I originally wanted to buy a walnut cranberry loaf, but it was sold out by 3 pm, so I bought the challah bread instead. It was super fluffy, eggy awesomeness. I toasted and dipped it with homemade garlic-and-spices olive oil and that just took me to nomnomnom heaven!
author: Cindy M.

description: It's easy: I come from two cultures where bread is incredibly important, sacred even, and Acme is my favorite bread store in SF. Love their breads!
author: Faruk A.

description: I love good bread and this place has all different kinds! I had a little puff pastry  with cheese and onions it was amazing !!! I also got a mini baguette it went well with my cheese and the perfect size for one person with  out leftovers! I will stop by this place again the next time I am in the city
author: Jessica S.

description: We always stop here for "rustic round" either at arrival or departure in the Ferry Building. Today we also got an olive bun and a cheese round. Very tasty. It's totally disappointing that they didn't not sell pats of butter, but Cowgirl Creamery is in the stall next door, so we always pick up some brie.
author: Steve K.

description:
I find the bread here to be better than at the one in Berkeley. The ear of wheat is incredibly soft and delicious. Perfect, and never burnt. I also love how they put a sample of all the bread and have a sign with the ingredients

I recommend getting it from 4-6, for some reason that's when it is best :)
author: Emily X.

description: If you are a bread connoisseur, you need to run to Acme's before they run out of bread!!  Their bread is super yummy and yeasty.  It is located inside the Ferry building.  I buy some bread here, some Redhawk Cheese from Cowgirl Creamery and some Blue Bottle Coffee for a spontaneous picnic on the bench in the back of the building while enjoying the view of the ferries, view and people walking by.
author: Mei W.

description: Bought a loaf of sourdough while at the ferry building.  Best Buy the whole vacation!!!  When locals are in line too, you know it's good. Ate some the next morning for breakfast before heading out. Highly recommended!!
author: Deb R.

description:
Located in the Ferry Building with super friendly staff, this shop has a ton of different types of freshly made bread.

I came for sourdough to bring home and bought a round and large baguette...each was in the $3.50 range.

If you don't know what you want, they do offer samples...everything I tasted was delicious!
author: Lucky S.

description: We love Acme Bread! We pretty much stick to their baguette, epi, pain levain and their deli rolls depending on what we are doing. Have not tried their pastries or sandwiches, but judging from the line they must be good. Always friendly service as well.
author: John C.

description: Wonderful quality bread! A definite go-to at the Ferry Building. Grab a baguette from here, some cheese from Cowgirl and some charcuterie from Boccolone, and you're good to go!
author: Angelica K.

description: This place is legit! I came on the Ferry from Oakland and I stopped right inside the Ferry Building! This place had a line and I know my hubby loves Acme bread! I waited in line which wasn't that long! They had so many bread selections on the table I wanted to try them all! I knew I could only pick a few. I picked a roll for my son and I to snack on while we were in the City. The roll was the perfect size for us to snack on and my son loved it! The roll was nice and soft and tasted amazing! I brought back a loaf for my hubby! We enjoyed it for a week! It was so delish! Also, the customer service was amazing! Thank you to all the workers for putting up with people like us who love bread and can't get enough of it! We will definitely be back soon!!!
author: Crissy G.

description: Picked up a loaf of bread from Acme at Whole Foods for a dinner party which was a good choice. At the party we were strongly encouraged to try their cheese roll by a friend and so we picked one up at this location. The roll was different than we expected in a very good way.
author: K L.

description:
Calling all BREAD LOVERS! Acme is always a good idea. The cheese sandwich has never disappointed me! A sandwich with fresh ingredients under $9.00 is a deal in the financial district plus your tummy will love you! Or the cheese roll is the best snack! If your in the Ferry building it's a must STOP.

Tip: if you pay with cash= discount!
author: Jillian S.

description: I've seen the gates of heaven and they let me in. If you are a bread lover like me then you'll understand my opening sentence. Huge choice, high quality, fast service and quality of product kept for artists. Not expensive and pretentious but instead simple and soooo good. Do yourself a favor and dash over if bread does it for you. Great salami sandwich, my personal favorite.
author: Shai L.

description:
There's a good reason why almost every sandwich shop in the Bay uses Acme bread, this stuff is amazing.

Bread: I don't mind allocating all my daily carb intake at Acme, their bread is always fresh, soft and deliciously addictive. I recommend grabbing a loaf of your favorite bread, maybe a croissant or so and then head over to Cowgirl Creamery for some delicious cheese. They pair so well together. More than anything I enjoy their whole wheat selection, not as dry as other whole wheat bread and still very soft. They also offer about three sandwiches daily (approx. $6.00), never tried them, but they always sounds so delicious and creative. 

Price: Large and filling bread portions are a very fair price, best part of Acme is their quality.

Service: Long long lines, but it goes by fast. Quick and friendly service, it's good to know what you want before you get to the register.

Ambiance: Not much of an ambiance, because it's a stand. However, you can smell the delicious bread, cute signage and display that'll make you crave carbohydrates.

Overall: High quality, fairly priced and large selection of tasty bread options.
author: Astrid Z.

description:
Incredible bread offerings! What a gem this place is. I go every 1-2 weeks and get a loaf or two for sandwiches. Slice it up, store in the freezer and you're good to go. It's like fresh artisan bread every day! I usually get the sour loaf and highly recommend it, though they were out of it this past time (a busy Saturday), so I go the Pain de Mie (like a soft white) and it's also very good! I've become so spoiled by this bread that I don't like anything from the grocery store anymore. And the best part is how reasonably priced it is - the sour loaf is under $4 and I can usually get 8 sandwiches out of it. Can't beat the value!

PS. Pro tip - get yourself a ceramic chef's knife to make the slicing oh-so-easy and clean. Thank me later.
author: Blake C.

description: Love this bread company! I highly recommend the Pain Epi!!!! But any of their loaves are worth the trip out here
author: Martine D.

description:
The fact that you can see all the bread right in front of you is so awesome. The line was packed and all the people working the retail line where so pleasant. we took home a sour baguette and a long italian and had such a grand time trekking the tourist area of our beloved city with baguettes in our backpacks.

We had purchased them to go with the country pork pate from Boccolone. Everybody at the picnic we brought it too loved the baguettes. 

So yummy!
author: Niana D.

description: In the desert of overpriced places around ferry bldg this is an oasis! Outstanding products at reasonable price. Try the pumpkin bread and/or the pumpkin roll or both. Its tast is so balanced like a symphony. Unfortunately my english isnt good enough to describe the experience you have taking the first bite. Fabelhaft!
author: Josef P.

description:
Amazing consistency in quality, despite the volume and variety.  Reasonable prices. If you're a visitor or otherwise don't need regular loaves or an entire baguette, there are plenty of options. You could get a single roll to snack on. There's also no minimum amount for a charge,  as far as I know. My bill was $2.83. I didn't have quite enough cash left and there was no problem charging it. As others have mentioned, there is a cash discount.

When I was there in the afternoon, there was only one clerk because the line wasn't that long. She looked tired but was unfailingly pleasant and prompt.

Hats off to the owners and staff of Acme Bread Company. You deserve five stars.
author: Violet H.

description:
Acme Bread Company is a bit of a legend in the Bay Area hitting several key demographics in one fell swoop. The local bakery makes gourmet breads of many different shapes and sizes using organic ingredients. They are found in many fancy restaurants and upscale markets, but their location in the Ferry Building is always a favorite due to location and the freshness of items baked right behind the counter!

Their setup is rather simple - a large counter showing off various baked goods. Their specialty is savory bread, but there are usually a few sweet options available. I love grabbing something from them and eating it while walking around. The line is usually long, but it moves fast. This location is cash only, so make sure to bring some.

There is just something about fresh bread from Acme. It is not that more expensive than regular bread, and is just much better. Perfect and popular and a great fit in San Francisco.
author: Kristian D.

description: This place makes yummy fresh pastries.  It was quite busy on the weekend.  It's great to grab coffee, walk around the Ferry Building, and get some bread and pastries from Acme Bread Company.
author: Jason G.

description: Like Boudin what is there not to love about Acme bread! its one of my favorite in San Francisco.
author: Meishi M.

description: Wonderful bakery. We stayed at a hotel down the street and we have had breakfast from there twice this week so far and definitely will go back a few more times before we leave San Francisco. Honestly good brad and croissant. Very buttery and flaky. I wish we had a bakery like this back home...
author: Ziad J.

description: The best bread you'll find in San Francisco. Pick up a sour dough baguette or batard from here, and then pick up some olive oil from the neighboring Stonehouse California Olive Oil.
author: Jade M.

description:
Quality of the bread is great as always, but the service is horrible. Just went their with a relative visiting from Europe and were served by a really rude woman with black long hair.

Not only did she literally yawn several times in our face without covering her mouth, she also didn't bother to answer in a friendly way when we asked if Kaiser rolls are available.
Now maybe she was just having a bad day or was tired, but still her behavior was extremely rude.
author: Sandra W.

description: I'm the type of person who would eat bread with every meal if I could so bread companies are heaven-sent blessings for me. Acme makes me want to buy bread every time I walk past it inside the Ferry Building. The store has a great variety of fresh, flavorful bread. Most recently, purchased the ciabatta and the green onion slab. The ciabatta was good, but the green onion slab was GREAT. I would highly recommend it! It may be a bit confusing or intimidating to see all the bread displayed before you, but I would just jump in and ask for recommendations if you're unsure. Service here has always been very consistent an friendly. Acme has two Berkeley locations that you can visit if you have a bread craving while you're in the East Bay.
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Tasty and with good conscious, socially and environmentally. We picked up leftover bread in bulk from Acme when I lived the co-op so delicious. Nice to see they have sandwiches
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description: Love stopping in for bread and rolls when I'm over at the Ferry Building. I especially love their hamburger buns, since they don't sell them to stores and they are Da Bomb!!! They are our secret to an amazing burger!!! Their sourdough is pretty rockin' too, I've actually used it at Thanksgiving to cut up for stuffing....mmmm. Only the best for the Fam! Nothing better than bread and a big slab of butter....Acme oh yeah!
author: Susan D.

description:
Ugh, why does bread have to be so good. 

Refrained from getting a whole baguette because I knew it would be demolished over the course of a day wandering SF.  Opted for the cheesy sourdough wheel, as per the recommendation of the cashier, and was impressed. Each bite was incredible in terms of flavor and texture-- it was chewy, soft, fluffy, yet salty/slightly crispy from the cheesy center/exterior that holds the wheel together. Even better when warm.
author: Rosa Y.

description: I regret not getting the sandwiches when I was here, but again i was stuffed from eating at the other places inside the Ferry Building. Next time, I will definitely try them! The line went by fast, and soon I was out with a small round of sourdough ($2.10). The sourdough had a great crust and chewy interior. I enjoyed it in sandwiches and made bread pudding with them after being day old.
author: Eva I.

description:
I have heard a lot about Acme Bread from my colleagues. So I decided to grab it for breakfast today. I chose the Cinnamon Currant and I am very glad about my choice.
So full of flavor and the bread tastes so fresh.

Highly recommend this place!!
author: Steffi C.

description: Only bread company in the Bay are that makes me feel like I'm having fresh European baguettes and rolls. Their quality is amazing, the prices are extremely fair, and the bread reheats well. Unfortunately, they sell out fast so if you want a sourdough loaf make sure you get there early in the day!
author: Courtney A.

description: Sourdough baguette from here, Mt. Tam cheese from Cowgirl Creamery and two hands to eat them with whilst sitting on the pier = #bliss! :)
author: Jana B.

description: The mass amount of positive reviews speak for itself. This place is really good! I've been coming here anytime my family visited the city and the quality of their bread is top-notch. Event though there's always a line, it moves fast and the people who work there are very nice.
author: James D.

description: So many bread options to choose from it made me wish I had a dinner party to plan in San Francisco.  Walking through the ferry building there are so many choices for foods to try and I had to make a decision. Given that we we had walked a long way and had much more to go (think 400 or more stairs just to start) we thought 'carbs!' Well frankly I kinda always think 'carbs' if I am being honest. We Picked a small sourdough round and a pumpkin loaf. The sourdough was chewy with a crust that was crispy. The pumpkin roll felt almost like a muffin. It had lots of pumpkin flavor and was dotted with dried fruit. If I live in this city I would be tempted often. I noted that At lunch at Barbacco they offered acme bread for the sandwiches too. Thumbs up!
author: Melanie D.

description:
Very busy, here, like all other places in the Ferry Building. 

Their pastries are gigantic... too bad the filling is hiding. Except for a couple of bites, the pain du chocolat looked like an empty croissant. The almond croissant was ok. 

I had some small bread, too - the rustic deli roll - and it was tasty. I wouldn't really venture here, considering the crowds and their prices.
author: Giacomo C.

description:
Looking for freshly baked European style baguette, croissant, pain au chocolat, or any bread derivative? Look no more, u are in the right place!

Many times we got there and the bread was still hot right from the baking oven.

Great service too and perfect location. 

Only cash accepted.
author: Gilbert B.

description:
Deliciousness!

The scent walking by Acme is enough to initially draw you in; the breads behind the display are the reason you'll queue up. 

I enjoy the small sourdough round or cheese wheel (often sells out). Had the sourdough cheese roll today which was good... But doesn't make my #1 or #2.

Staff is generally friendly and this place is worth the wait!
author: Kristin Leigh M.

description:
Acme bread stays open on holidays so you can get that fresh bread on your table for your family. What more could you want? Acme serves up some amazing loaves and their sweet baguettes are a staple for myself and apparently everyone else in line with me on thanksgiving day.

Come by later in the night if you are in the neighborhood. The ferry building is less crowded and you can admire their bakers work their magic!
author: Patricia K.

description:
An excellent organic bakery store located in the Ferry Building Marketplace (the original location is actually located at Berkeley).

Acme bread company mainly sells different varieties of French artisan breads such as rustic sweet baguette, challah (only available on Fri, Sat, and Sun), pain de mie, herb slab, etc. In addition to breads, they also sell three different types of sandwiches: salame sandwich, cheese sandwich, and roasted beet (not beef) sandwich - you can only buy them from 11 AM to 2:30 PM or until sandwiches are sold out.

Cheese sandwich (rustic baguette, Mt. Tam triple creme cheese, fruit jam, arugula, black pepper - $5.85): What an interesting and unique flavor! Sweet savory with a hint of creaminess. HIGHLY recommended. (4.5/5)

Pain epi (organic wheat flour, water, salt, yeast, malted barley flour - $2.45): Basically a zig zag shape baguette and it still tasted like ... baguette (not sweet with somewhat bland, hard, and crusty texture). If you are looking for a better experience, then try Mt. Tam cheese from Cowgirl Creamery next door together with pain epi (which I didn't know at the time ... and now I know). (4/5)

For the quality you are getting, I think this is a great place for a quick grab-and-go. You will probably find more hits than misses for their different varieties of breads.
author: Luke L.

description:
Freshly baked bread, Mt. Tam Cheese, melted Raclette, grilled cheese sandwich, earl grey panna cotta... 

Need I say more? 

P.S. They validate parking!

P.P.S. They charge $1 for a cup for water, but free if you bring your own container (hooray for being environmentally friendly)
author: Audrey L.

description:
Located in the the famed Ferry Building in San Francisco's Embarcadero, I stumbled here as I perused through the multitude of kitschy shops. I could not believe the selection of fresh breads that this place had, and the long line. It was amazing to see such a demand. Things took a turn for the better as I purchased an apple turnover and cinnamon roll to go with my Blue Bottle coffee. 

While I would have preferred to have both items warm, impatience got the best of me. The apple turnover was a big surprise. Biting into the flaky layers, you'll come across fresh and crunchy apple pieces. It's like having a slice of a fresh-baked apple pie. Feels likes home. The cinnamon roll wasn't too surprising, but well balanced in flavor as you get a little cinnamon flavor for all the bread you bite though. Either way, both items were very fresh, crisp, and baked to perfection. I enjoyed it, and hopefully be back for some more.
author: Mohib Q.

description: Acme bread is so delicious!! I always come here for their bread when I make the trip up to SF. The best thing to do is buy cheese from Cowgirl Creamery nearby and then pair it with their bread. Yummy! I actually would've just purchased a sandwich from Acme but it looks like they don't serve them after 2:30 pm. Yesterday, I had both the olive bread and herb focaccia. Amazing!
author: Audrey L.

description: Just go here if you like bread. I am a really big fan of Acme bread. We get it at different locations in the south bay and it is always fresh and great tasting. We ordered several pastries at this location including: apple turnover, croissant, grain muffins. The apple turnover is just how I like it, not too sweet and no sugary coating on the outside, just great pastry. As others mentioned the prices are so good here. You would think for a tourist spot they would jack up the price, but they don't.
author: greg w.

description: Came here Saturday for some baguettes. We waited in line for about 5 minutes and was promptly given my bread. I love how they have all the breads out on display for you to pick and choose from. We ordered the Epi pain and a Rustic Sweet baguette. They're both equally amazing. They're moist and the crust is the right amount of crunch.
author: Ang W.

description:
Just go get bread from them.  If you don't like it, I give YOU 1 star.  Everything here is excellent and moderately priced.

Sometimes I walk 20 minutes each way during lunch to get here, like today.
author: Ty C.

description: Delicious freshly baked bread can never be a bad thing, especially when you can see them baking it in the windows behind the Ferry Building.  If you're in the area or in the Ferry Building, pay with cash to get a discount, walk around holding a bread in a paper bag like you're European, go home and enjoy it with some butter and jam and tell yourself that you had a good day. Acme is a great place to indulge in carbs and I feel quite fortunate to live so close to it!
author: Lisa I.

description:
At least now I can say that I left San Francisco having tried sourdough bread...or did I?

Heard great stuff about Acme, although I wasn't into buying the tourist trap prices of the Ferry Market but there are literally hundreds of fresh, gourmet breads in front of you--can you really resist?

Nope.

So much yeast, so little time. I really wanted to get a huge, plain sourdough bun but I like variety on my food so like mice, the cheese was tempting. Of course, now I wish I chose something else. It was either the Cheese Wheel or the Roll and I got the roll. I've never paid $4 for bread/bun--not even a loaf of bread--very expensive. 

I eat the Cheese Roll..super hard to pull off, it took 2 people some pulling and tugging to finally rip a piece off. The cheese isn't bad but I guess because it cooled off since coming out of the oven, it's not as tasty as it would've been. Dough was great quality but I didn't like the roll overall. Well, there's my sourdough experience...
author: Sharon T.

description:
Simple - Easy - Fast moving line - Smells great - Tastes wonderful - mmmmm...
There is the summary and I loved my last olive roll. wow! under a buck and a quick snack as I wandered. Back for more later - irresistible! Oh how I love those carbs.
author: Charley C.

description: Wonderful, delicious bread. We tried, sourdough cheese wheel, sourdough loaf,  olive rolls,  rosemary rolls and a baguette. There were so many options and we were trying to decide but the counter girl was unhelpful and borderline rude. This only took us longer and made to feel uncomfortable as she kept looking at the line forming behind us....as if to say...move it along. But.....the bread is so worth it!!
author: Christina M.

description:
Acme bread company is fairly well known in the bay area. You will often see vendors boasting that they serve their sandwiches on Acme bread. I have walked past their storefront in the ferry building countless times and today I finally got around to trying them out.

They have a huge amount of options available, and more options always makes me happy. The quality of their bread is definitely good, and I did enjoy using their rustic sweet bread to make sandwiches at home. 

Overall, while I can't really bring myself to give a very high rating to a bakery based on bread alone, I do think Acme is quality material and I will be coming back for more in the future, especially since they provide so many choices.
author: Mark O.

description: Acme Bread is responsible for me falling in love with levain bread.  I searched for a long time for the perfect crusty bread to soak up delicious soup or dip in fresh olive oil, and I found my favorite in the levain bread here.  The bad news is that it is really hard to break out of this bad carb habit because there tons of delicious soups and fresh olive oil nearby.
author: Ally W.

description: Love this place. The apple strudel is neither so sweet nor heavy. Other breads are awesome as well. Pretty good for roaming around and grabbing a bite.
author: Aayush S.

description:
Love their Epi bread!!!! Sometimes on really humid days the bread is not as tasty/stale, but most of the time the texture is just right. Get bread here and then go to Cowgirl creamery to pick up some Triple Cream (taste like butter!) 

Bring cash.
author: Logan N.

description:
Came here on Monday morning to check out the ferry building. Read great things about Acme so the husband and I picked up a French baguette and a pain au chocolat. 

They had an amazing selection of different breads. They basically have anything you could ever want, including hot dog buns!

The French bread had the perfect texture and flavor. The pain au chocolat was not as flakey and buttery as its European counterpart, but it was still very good (way better than other American bakeries I've tried). 

I need to find me a bakery in LA that's as good as Acme!
author: Angela D.

description:
Some of the best fresh bread around, I stop here before I jump on the ferry. From sourdough, olive bread, whole wheat bread and much more. All they do is bake bread, nothing more, and they are really good at it!

Many of the items I buy are organic.

Later on in the afternoon, they usually sell out of most of the good items. I would therefore recommend picking up crtical items earlier to ensure you dont miss out.

FYI - They offer a small cash discount.
author: Jared B.

description: Seriously delicious bread and reasonable! If you like olives they have an awesome olive roll. I stopped at a cheese shop by this bakery to have some home made pimento cheese with my bread and wow... so excellent! Also, many other restaurants use their bread around the Bay area.
author: Heather M.

description: We got 2 baguettes, sour dough and regular. They were both amazing! This was recommended by a friend
author: Daniel O.

description: This is about the chocolate croissant only - if you like Acme crusty bread, you'll enjoy their crusty croissant.  I prefer mine buttery.  Not recommend.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Visited the Ferry Building recently and had to make a choice as to what to eat for lunch.  I love fresh baked bread, so the decision was fairly simple.  I got the salami sandwich since it was "grab and go".  The bread was simply amazing.  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The salami was very flavorful as well.  

After walking around for a bit, came back and bought a loaf of bread to take home.  If this was closer to work, I'd be here all the time.  They have an amazing variety of artisan breads to choose from.
author: Lon H.

description:
No carb, no schmarb.

With the health craze of axing all bready deliciousness due to the risk of love handles and jelly rolls; Acme Bread Company still stands the test of time and even tempts the strongest of dieters.

Perfectly crisp and delightfully soft in the middle, I can't imagine a better accompaniment to a sweet picnic for two or a lavish dinner with many. Acme bread always scores beaucoup points!

They pride themselves on using organic whole grain flour and butter. They even take it a step further and use only organic raisins and organic pumpkin seeds. 

With small companies like these, I always find that they are resourceful and have a dynamic impact on the surrounding community. 

In 2008, they covered the bakery in Berkeley with photovoltaic panels which helps create most of their own energy. 

In 1983, when they first opened their doors, they only offered 4 different types of bread. As the years have gone on, they now offer over 100 different products; all equally delicious and with each having their own fan base.

My absolute favorite is the torpedo roll. I can seriously eat that stuff all day. Not to mention how incredible it tastes with a good Brie cheese. Truly perfect.

Many restaurants and specialty grocery stores seek their product as a compliment to any dish or on its own.

It never fails, every time I walk past this place, the aroma of fresh baked bread allures me. 

I guess my love handles are here to stay.
author: Ann S.

description:
THE PAIN EPI! :D 

Pair that with European style butter or Mt. Tam cheese from Cowgirl Creamery next door. 

See what I did there? Promoting Acme's products AND vouching for Cowgirl's too -- all in one review. 

I'm a very efficient yelper.
author: Janice C.

description:
Cranberry Walnut Wheat is my favorite bread. I don't mean just my favorite at Acmi, I mean my FAVORITE! It's THAT good. 

Great crunchy crust, soft inside, with juicy sweet cranberries and toasted walnuts. Oh the flavors in each bite. 

This bread is so good, I can eat it all by itself.
author: Nina M.

description:
Carb Heaven! Bread from here + cheese from Cowgirl Creamery next door = one happy girl!

I wanted a light snack, which actually turned into a heavy snack because I couldn't stop eating! i got the olive roll with the cheese that I bought next door. The olive roll was good and had actual olives in it was gave it a salty and tangy flavor. I just wish I bought more bread to try with my cheeses! Oh well... I'll be back.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Grabbed a couple loafs of sourdough before heading home. Located right at Ferry 1, tons of other shops in the area too.
author: Dean P.

description: If you love bread, this is your place. They have so many different breads to choose from, and you really can't go wrong! I had a traditional sourdough roll and a sesame seed challah roll. I enjoyed the challah more, but I would certainly eat both again. I ate them on the run, but if you order sourdough I recommend you take it home and heat it up before eating it so that it is more moist. Make sure you stop by Cowgirl Creamery next door for some delicious cheese to pair with your bread!
author: Briana B.

description:
Yum yum yum. I love the olive bread from this place. They always seem to run out before the end of the day, so I know others love the bread too! Get here semi-early. They run out of a lot of their breads before ~3pm.

The bread is relatively well priced:
- $1 or less for rolls
- $4-5 for loaves
- $2-4 for baguettes
- $5.30 for challah

There's a good amount of different breads. Cash only

Go check it out!
author: Christina L.

description: The best bread in California. I haven't eaten bread extensively outside of the state so my sample size would be too small, so I can only definitively pronounce it the best in the state.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
* Little star *

Q:  What goes well with a breakfast yogurt from Cowgirl Creamery Sidekick?  (http://www.yelp.ca/biz/cowgirl-creamery-sidekick-san-francisco?hrid=gySOQK5llIB4a10vvxTWRw)  

A:  A twinkle.  Yes, a twinkle.  This 80 cent miniloaf made the perfect accompaniment to my breakfast yogurt and fruit.  Excellent crust, perfect centre. Photos: http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/acme-bread-company-san-francisco-2?select=ixsQeGa9FjVwGtLJHSFthQ#ixsQeGa9FjVwGtLJHSFthQ and http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/acme-bread-company-san-francisco-2?select=yD9eYGqY-Av362zUKI0GwQ#yD9eYGqY-Av362zUKI0GwQ   

Overall a great mini-loaf - and so reasonably priced! Just makes me want to say, Twinkle, Twinkle.......
author: Marc D.

description: Some of the best bread ever! So many varieties and so cheap!!! A carb lover's heaven!!! Cash only.
author: Denise L.

description: Bread is super fresh and so good!  I had to come by this place before leaving San Francisco so I can get some bread to go.  They have so many different kinds to choose from, and the prices are not expensive at all...less than $3 for a loaf of bread.
author: Hania A.

description:
OMG Fresh bake bread every day when I get to work. 
What can be better. :) 
I love their rustic bread but seems their prices increase overtime compare to my salary.
author: Diem H.

description: I love the location, and it appears to be a legit operation, but the sourdough round left me unfulfilled.  It was so crispy and tough on the outside that I literally could not even tear a piece off with my bare hands.  Similarly, the interior was a little too stale. Perhaps this was due to the timing;  I purchased at 5:30 p.m.  But a bakery's baked goods should still be edible within a few hours.
author: Sasha R.

description:
I LOVE BREAD! I was here over the weekend and was drawn in due to the smell of amazing aroma of freshly baked bread. Who can resist, right? This was my first time at Acme Bread Company and I walked away with a green onion slab and a cheddar cheese roll. You can't go wrong with any of their bread it seems. 

With all the scare stories about what commercial bakeries are putting in your breads (i.e. things that can be found in yoga mats), it's a safe bet to go with the real deal bakeries. 

Acme Bread Company uses organic, whole-grain flours and incorporates as many organic and locally sourced ingredients as possible. I can definitely support this and can't wait to come back for more bread. 

** My only wish is that they will start accepting credit cards in the future. That would make it more convenient for shoppers at the Ferry Building.
author: Steph F.

description:
I love Acme bread. It's delicious whether in sandwiches, stand alone, spreads, or with whatever you prefer your bread with. Anyone that dislikes Acme is a liar and hates bread. Yup I said it.

If there's a line, it's not bad since the cashier's move with purpose, hustling about & grabbing your bread then ringing it up. Cash only. 

How can you say no to fresh baked bread? Even the neighborhood restaurants send out workers to grab fresh bread from here throughout the day and you can find Acme bread in dozens of food trucks, it's the de facto bread everyone uses!

They do run out near the end of the day for obvious reasons.
author: Steven C.

description:
Because....bread.

What can I say about Acme? What can I NOT say? 

Best bread ever. Grab some bread from and some cheese from Cowgirl Creamery and you're good to go. You're welcome.
author: Christine R.

description: If you are in the Embarcadero area our touring the SF Ferry Building you should definitely stop by here for some Fresh SF bread! You can stop and bring some home to go or eat it on your way around. A must try!
author: Michelle M.

description: Bread is all four of my food groups.  I love and seek good bread.  I have eaten tons (literally) of bread in the Bay Area and Boston.  There is a lot of very good bread in both. Without question, Acme's Walnut Levain is THE BEST bread.  I discovered it first in 1995.  I have left and come back. I've had Tartine, Josey Baker and plenty of others.  Acme's remains THE BEST.
author: Christopher B.

description: Delightfully fresh and flavorful bread. The only place really like it in the Ferry Building. I could eat a whole loaf of their bread if I'm not careful. My favorite right now is the herb loaf but the multigrain is good too. One star for being a bit too pricey on specialty loaves like olive bread.
author: Laurel S.

description:
The bread is consistently good, the prices reasonable, the lines fast, and it's completely WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE!!! 

I highly recommend the Herb Slab...you'll thank me later!!!  Cut it up into cubes and dip it in good olive oil...or slice it in half and use it to make panini...mmmm!!!!
author: Amy L.

description: My one and only go-to place for BREAD and all things wheat-y! They make the freshest breads in town and certainly offer a good amount of variety for different taste palettes. Their pastry and sandwich selection is also delicious - my all-time fave: the cheese sandwich. Mmmmmm...
author: Mer R.

description: Located inside the ferry building, great prices, and wonderful fresh bread. I love the rustic roll and the raisin rabbit!
author: Natalie L.

description:
After spending a summer in Europe, fresh bread means so much more to me. Forget those loafs of bread from Safeway and Costco - freshly baked breads is HOW YOU LIVE.

With that said, Acme makes some bombass bread.

After a failed morning of brunch (due to one parts my impatience, two parts the hunger), my boyfriend and I scrambled about looking for a snack. And presented before us - Acme! We dived in for the Mt. Tam sandwich, and it was perfection. 

The Mt. Tam ($5.70): Fruit jam (I had a fig-apricot jam that day), Cowgirl Creamery's Triple creme (think brie), fresh arugula, and black pepper. All on top of a sweet rustic loaf.

Some might say it's pricey, but I think it's the price you're going to pay for fresh, locally sourced, delicious food. And dieters, suck it up, this bread is amazing! Plus, carbs are good for the soul!
author: Colleen M.

description:
Lots of breads, freshly baked with crispy, crunchy exteriors and soft interiors available at very reasonable prices.  They smell great and taste great, too.  

The breads vary from small rolls to large boules, from zigzagging epees to long baguettes.  The lines can get a little long, but they move quickly.
author: Edward M.

description:
The lines here are VERY long on occasion and they only take cash, but the bread they bake here is so darn GOOD that's it's totlaly worth the freight - and then some!

Come and tasting this amazing stuff for yourself; you'll see exactly what I mean :-)
author: Glenn G.

description:
I come from a bread loving family, on both sides; we have detailed discussions about crust and crumb.  Acme bread is a favorite.  It is what we measure other breads against.  When I visit friends and family out of the area, it is the bread I take them.  
The sweetdough and sourdough make such great toast.   Mmmm, toast.
author: Anna L.

description: This bakery smelled delicious and made my mouth water. Conveniently located next to cowgirl creamery, the bread complimented our Red Hawk sliced cheese and Fig jam. The only downfall is the line and impatient cashier waiting for you to decide what you want. I went with herb focaccia and a 87 cent torpedo bread. Pan de epi was popular but I decided not to get it because the Hog Island restaurant used that bread.
author: Melanie L.

description:
I ran over from my new job to get one of the pre-made sandwiches. Dang it was good. 

I used to eat a lot of cheese and jelly sandwiches in College after a night out. It was just the easiest thing to keep cold on our window ledge after a night of drinking.

Anyway today's selection was Mt Tam cheese with fig jam and arugula on an acme baguette. It was about $5-6...It just really hit the spot, I suppose I could have used more cheese inside, but really then you'd need more jam and more arugula and a bigger roll (slippery slope!).

I'll be back, I wanna try the daily foccacia (today's was asparagus for $5) But I doubt they heat it and that is the way I'd want it.
author: Amy W.

description: Workers are grouchy but the bread is good.
author: Chris L.

description:
Green Garlic Sandwich  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/I19ntZQrZxMn9gYOOK1rhg?select=1LaW0gYPuatGbOl-eYngcw) = bomb!

*** and I don't even like goat cheese
author: Mike C.

description:
Fresh baked delicious bread of all different kinds...from a 60 cent roll on up.

The banquettes are probably the best value and the best crusty-outside and soft-inside bread in San Francisco,

There must be upwards of 30 varieties of bread here and I apologize if I gave too low of a count.  

The service is friendly and efficient as the line moves quickly because the shelves are just behind the counter.  Go get some cheese and some fresh cut salami and enjoy a gourmet lunch at a great price.
author: William M.

description:
I love this bread. love love love love love love. I can't get enough of it. If there wasn't a cash only policy, I'd give them my credit card and walk away with all the bread. 

I love the green onion slab. Whatever you're planning for, buy double, because you can't stop eating the bread before your event. This bread is perfect for sandwiches. I like getting this bread for dinner near lunch time but I always seem to finish half before the occasion. 

I'm also a huge fan of the cranberry walnut bread. It's so rustic in flavor. The last time I was there, I seriously wanted to jump over the counter and take a bite out of the cranberry walnut breads that just came out of the oven. OH MAN! So sexy!

You can't go wrong with any of the bread. I like my bread a bit toasted and boy, these breads are as seductive as it gets. The crust is also so crispy and the insides are so flavorful. 

My mom praises and curses me every time I bring her bread. You seriously cannot stop yourself from munching and snacking on the bread. Atkins dieters: do not cross by this place, you will fall off the wagon.
author: Anh T.

description: Very very happy with this bread mmm :) I tried loaves of their olive bread and pear bread. Both so wholesome and real, awesome texture and flavor.
author: Lisa K.

description:
A little pricey, but the bread is great.

You can make a meal of it.  And, I have.
I get the loaf with herbs in it.  Sorry, I can't be more specific.
But, I always get the same thing every time I go there and then wash it down with an orange soda from the stand around the corner.

I will be sure to get the name of the vendor for the orange soda next time.
author: Joe S.

description:
They might look simple, but the flavors of the breads impressed hugely.
I had the walnut levain and it's great just by itself!
author: Ck S.

description: Cheap and Good! It's one of the only places that you can get a good sandwich for under 10 dollars in San Francisco.
author: Christian A.

description: Got the olive bread and chocolate croissant. Both were delicious. Plenty of olives in the olive bread.
author: Jones J.

description:
CARBS YOU EVIL CARBS! I HATE YOU ACME FOR BEING THE DEVIL BUT I LOVE YOU SO DAMN MUCH!

**1/2 off all day old breads - the seran wrapped ones on the side of the wall!**

This bakery is charmingly located in the center of San Francisco's Ferry Building along the pier at the Embarcadero. Although not its own facility, they bake their breads fresh in the large open kitchen behind the counter.

1. Green onion slab - possibly one of my favorite breads of all time. It's incredibly soft and has a considerate amount of diced fresh scallions scattered throughout the loaf. The name "slab" accurately portrays what this bread is -- literally a SLAB of perfectly baked dough embedded with green onions. The inside is chewy and soft and will remain soft even after a while. Great with spreadable cheeses and does not have to be toasted. 

2. Sourdough cheese wheel - guilty pleasure. A generous mixture of (?) parmesan, asiago, and romano (?) cheese is melted on top of a large wheel of fresh sourdough. The saltiness of the cheese is not too overpowering. However, be warned that the sourdough is tough and chewy and will leave your jaws sore :( It can also tend to be greasy from the oils on the cheese so take a couple of napkins to go.

3. Sourdough cheese roll - a nice, softer alternative to the sourdough cheese wheel. Good if you want something a little smaller for breakfast.

4. Challah roll - one of my favorites. I believe it comes in plain, poppy, and sesame. I nabbed a sesame one before work and finished the whole thing before I even arrived to my office. It's a spongy, incredibly soft roll with a slightly sweet taste and the sesame seeds are toasted perfectly and compliment the plain tasting bun. 

All in all, this is one of the best bakeries in the city. Everything is affordable and I see MANY people have acme cater their events. Usually there are only one or two guys working the counter so service can seem a little slow (they like to take their times with people picking up large orders) and unpredictable, but it's a small price to pay for the best bread ever.

Note: cash only!
author: Shirley N.

description:
I love Acme Bread.  I will continue to trek all the way from Ocean Beach to take in the sights and sounds of the Saturday Farmer's Market which gives me an excuse to stop by their shop and grab a loaf or two.  Today's experience will not deter me from coming back, but I hope the company will do something about the disrespect I received from one of their employees.  This happened just a few minutes ago and though I didn't get her name, she wears glasses and her dyed hair is always in a ponytail.

I decided to take my parents to the Ferry Building today, as it wasn't raining and I thought it would make for a nice outing, since they are visiting from Southern California.  As usual, I stop by for a loaf of bread and apple turnovers as treats for my parents.  My Mom decides at the last minute to switch to a cinnamon roll, and that earned us a scowl and a gruff ... 'Let me change that since you CHANGED your mind' while she entered our orders at the till.  In fact, our encounter didn't seem to be off on a great start.  When I asked her for a Walnut Cranberry, she breathed out a heavy sigh before going to the wall where my bread was propped up.

Now I know their lines are long and they get quite busy.  My parents are nearing their 70s and make me do the talking when we're out.  I am wearing a splint on my left arm so my dexterity is not perfect.  When she tossed the change at my hand, a few coins fell onto the counter, and she stayed silent and continued to scowl at my clumsiness.  I still thanked her and left, but I had to share this experience.  It is Christmas and I'm a person who lets most things roll off her back.  This however, was just plain unacceptable.
author: Rhea S.

description:
25 years and still rocks like French and Italian bakeries of Europe.
Its my 2nd favorite bread bakery after Buchon in Napa.
It has that old world taste and feel when one "breaks bread".
author: David H.

description: Every time I see the Acme Bread sign, I am reminded of Wiley Coyote always chasing after the Road Runner  and then I think about how I am always "chasing" after the Torpedo Rolls at the Acme Bread Company. They make the best bread around hands down. My significant other loves their New York Rye and my teen will take every opportunity to steal my Torpedo Rolls. The best thing about this location is its close proximity to Blue Bottle Coffee. Just like Wiley Coyote, I died and went to heaven
author: N B.

description:
Delicious, delicious bread. While you can find some of their more popular breads in a Whole Foods, they have a wider selection here, baked fresh every day. 

But why stop at bread? Get one of their sandwiches for a bite, conveniently prepared with their own rolls, with yummy local ingredients. My favourite is the potato pesto. Mmmm carb on carb action.
author: Alice C.

description: Ugh just the absolute best bakery for bread! My favorite is the Rosemary roll and the pan epi! The Rosemary roll is great for just a snack and the pan epi is best with cowgirl creamery next door.
author: Samantha S.

description: This is good stuff but I wanted to comment that I love sourdough and we got the sour batard recently and it was a disappointment.  It's hardly sour at all. Other than that experience we've always like this place.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
DO NOT BE FOOLED, this place brings you the pain! Thus the name of one of their more popular bread, the PAIN EPI

Also, read carefully, it says roast BEET ( as in the redish purple vegetable that no one likes) not roast BEEF ( as in the savory protein that everyone loves ). 

IF i remember one thing about this place's bread, it is that they bring you the PAIN. OMG these breads are so hard, so tough, it is an exercise and testament of your jaw strength everytime you bite into them. My mouth still feels sore thinking about it now. My friend who got both the grilled cheese sandwich AND the PAIN epi had to take a break in between our BART ride to the SFO just so he can rest his jaws to finish and he eats french baguettes all the time! 

THEY BRING THE PAIN TO YOUR MOUTH!!! PAIN!
author: Ji T.

description:
Came to the Ferry building to eat at Roli Roti which I like to call Roli Roli and to have hot chocolate but unfortunately 99% of the establishments at the ferry building was closed for new years. Roli Roli wasn't out since it was raining or because it was new years. I don't Know. What I do know is I AM HUNGRY!

Looking down the wide corridor I see a bunch of people. They were ordering at Acme Bread Company. The BF asked if I wanted something here since we were hungry and waiting for the rain to die down. 

I was like ehh I am not sure if I wanna just eat bread but they had pastries! Awesome! 

We got a cheese roll and a something with chocolate in the inside. It was my BF's choice. My boyfriend and I loved the sourdough cheese wheel. I thought the chocolate thing was alright. Our sourdough cheese wheel was cold but still good. We wonder how yummy it would be if it was fresh out of the oven.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Simply the worst customer experience ever.  It doesn't even deserve one star.  I would give it negative stars if I could.

I went yesterday to pick up an herb loaf. When paying I was given the incorrect change back (I gave a $20 bill and was given back $1 and change instead of $16 and change).  When I corrected the employee, she looked at me and asked me if I was sure multiple times.  Fine, ok to ask once but don't ask me more than once.   

Then she brings back another employee and together they tell me that, according to their company policy they can't give me change because they aren't sure if I'm being honest.  WTF.  In one single conversation they made me feel like a criminal.  There was no apology.  They continued to tell me that people do "this" to them all the time and asked me again if I was sure.  I have never felt so accused.  

Their policy is to count up the register at the end of the day to determine if I was correct or not and then mail me a check if I am right.  Are you kidding? Instead why don't you teach your staff to look at the money properly, repeat the transaction back to the customer so then there are no issues to begin with.  Empower your staff to take care of the customer.  I was so upset I told them I didn't even want the bread anymore.  The other employee told me that they will have the manager call me back right away.  

Does the manager call that day?  No.  My husband called later on and they told us that the manager will call me first thing in the morning.  Does she call in the morning?  No.  So we call again and turns out they wrote my number down wrong.  (Again, please train your employees better). 

Finally we get an apology and a confession I was correct and had gave them a $20 bill.  Honestly I could care less about $20.  I just want to be treated fairly, given the benefit of the doubt, and an apology.  Basic common courtesy.  

I will never purchase Acme product again. I also plan tell everyone I know this.
author: Janet K.

description:
